title: Romeo and Juliet
author: William Shakespeare
Summary: Romeo and Juliet Summary. An age-old vendetta between two powerful families erupts into bloodshed. A group of masked Montagues risk further conflict by gatecrashing a Capulet party. A young lovesick Romeo Montague falls instantly in love with Juliet Capulet, who is due to marry her father's choice, the County Paris.

author: George Orwell
Summary: A man seeks hope in the midst of a totalitarian and repressive dystopian society that he can neither understand nor tolerate. He then dares to fall in love and is hunted down because he is guilty of a psycho-crime. Not even the darkest recesses of the mind can hide from the cold and inquiring gaze of Big Brother. Such a dark and virtual dictator requires, not only obedience, but blind and unconditional love.

title: 2001: a Space Odyssey
author: Arthur C. Clarke
Summary: The Monoliths push humanity to reach for the stars; after their discovery in Africa generations ago, the mysterious objects lead mankind on an awesome journey to Jupiter, with the help of H.A.L. 9000: the world's greatest supercomputer.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austin
Summary: Pride and Prejudice follows the turbulent relationship between Elizabeth Bennet, the daughter of a country gentleman, and Fitzwilliam Darcy, a rich aristocratic landowner. They must overcome the titular sins of pride and prejudice in order to fall in love and marry.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: Fitzgerald Scott
Summary: Set in Jazz Age New York, the novel tells the tragic story of Jay Gatsby, a self-made millionaire, and his pursuit of Daisy Buchanan, a wealthy young woman whom he loved in his youth.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
Summary: Frodo is a young Hobbit tasked with the perilous mission to carry the One Ring to Mordor and destroy it forever in the fires of Mount Doom

title: The Old Man and the Sea
author: Ernest Hemingway
Summary: The Old Man and the Sea is the story of an epic struggle between an old, seasoned fisherman and the greatest catch of his life. For eighty-four days, Santiago, an aged Cuban fisherman, has set out to sea and returned empty-handed.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
Summary: The story of Dorian Gray, an unscrupulous aristocrat, who remains young and beautiful as his portrait ages and represents all his sins and dark soul.

title: A Christmas Carol
author: Charles Dickens
Summary: A Christmas Carol is a play about a mean-spirited and selfish old man, Ebenezer Scrooge, who hates Christmas. One cold Christmas Eve, Scrooge is unkind to the people who work for him, then refuses to give to charity, and then is rude to his nephew when he invites him to spend Christmas with him.

title: Blade Runner: do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?
author: Philip K. Dick
Summary: In the near future, an investigator is tasked with eliminating a group of killer androids on the run from their maker, but in the course of his research he learns of a terrifying truth.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
Summary: Fahrenheit 451 is set in a dystopian society that burns books in order to control dangerous ideas and unhappy concepts. The novel tells the story of Guy Montag, a fireman who questions the book-burning policy and undergoes extraordinary suffering and transformation as a result.

title: IT
author: Stephen King
Summary: A group of teenagers discover the existence of an evil entity that feeds on the fears of humans and that has the appearance of a clown named Pennywise. The being, that dwells in the depths of the sewer system, is just one of the faces of the millennial creature known as It, a shapeless monster that wakes up cyclically to reap victims among the children of the city. To defeat him, the boys must stick together and keep alive the feeling of friendship that binds them.

title: Thinking fast and slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
Summary: Thinking Fast And Slow shows you how two systems in your brain are constantly fighting over control of your behavior and actions, and teaches you the many ways in which this leads to errors in memory, judgment and decisions, and what you can do about it.

title: The Da Vinci code
author: Dan Brown
Summary: A mystery that could shake the foundations of Christianity is hidden among the works of Leonardo. Professor Langdon sets out in search of the uncomfortable truth together with a French cryptologist.

title: Oliver Twist
author: Charles Dickens
Summary: Oliver, an orphan since birth, spends much of his childhood at a child farm (orphanage) with too many children and too little food. The farm is located roughly 70 miles outside London.

title: Pinocchio
author: Carlo Collodi
Summary: A wooden puppet gets a much-coveted chance to become a flesh-and-blood child.

title: The Beauty and the Beast
author: Madame Gabrielle-Suzanne Barbot de Villeneuve
Summary: A haughty and selfish young prince is turned into a beast at the hands of a fairy. The spell will be broken only if a maiden falls in love with him. As fate would have it, his life intersects with that of Belle, a young girl eager to escape a dull life. In fact, her father seeks asylum in a castle not knowing that the beast lives there and is taken prisoner. Belle goes to look for him and, finding him in the castle, offers herself as a hostage in his place

title: Rapunzel
author: Brothers Grimm
Summary: Flynn Rider is a charming bandit who, thanks to his good looks, loose talk, and a fair amount of luck, has always had it easy. Rapunzel, on the other hand, is a beautiful and extravagant girl with beautiful golden hair, over twenty feet long, who lives a recluse in a very tall tower. One day, while on the run from the authorities, Flynn finds shelter in the very tower where Rapunzel is confined

title: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
author: Brothers Grimm
Summary: The beautiful and kindhearted princess Snow White charms every creature in the kingdom except one - her jealous stepmother, the Queen. When the Magic Mirror proclaims Snow White the fairest one of all, she must flee into the forest, where she befriends the lovable seven dwarfs - Doc, Sneezy, Grumpy, Happy, Bashful, Sleepy, and Dopey. But when the Queen tricks Snow White with a poisoned apple and falling into a deep sleep, only the magic of true love's kiss can awaken her.

title: Little Red Riding Hood
author: Brothers Grimm
Summary: A young girl, Little Red Riding Hood, sets off through the woods to visit her sick grandmother. Along the way, she meets a wolf. The wolf rushes ahead of her to her grandmothers home, where he impersonates Little Red Riding Hood to gain access. The wolf eats the grandmother. When Red arrives, the wolf pretends to be her grandmother and eats her too.

title: Hansel and Gretel
author: Brothers Grimm
Summary: Hansel and Gretel are a brother and sister abandoned in a forest, where they fall into the hands of a witch who lives in a house made of gingerbread, cake, and candy. The cannibalistic witch intends to fatten the children before eventually eating them, but Gretel outwits the witch and kills her.

title: The Ugly Duckling
author: Hans Christian Andersen
Summary: A baby duckling is shunned by his family because he is different. He is also rejected by all of the other birds and animals. Finally a mother swan adopts him as one of her brood.

title: The Little Prince
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
Summary: The story follows a young prince who visits various planets in space, including Earth, and addresses themes of loneliness, friendship, love, and loss. Despite its style as a children's book, The Little Prince makes observations about life, adults and human nature.

title: The Princess and the Pea
author: Hans Christian Andersen
Summary: The prince does not intend to marry just any girl, but a woman who proves to be a "true princess," so he travels the world and searches all the kingdoms, but finds none that will satisfy him. One stormy night, a young girl knocks on the castle door, claiming to be a true princess.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
Summary: Katniss Everdeen voluntarily takes her younger sister's place in the Hunger Games: a televised competition in which two teenagers from each of the twelve Districts of Panem are chosen at random to fight to the death.

title: Twilight
author: Stephenie Meyer
Summary: When Bella Swan moves to a small town in the Pacific Northwest, she falls in love with Edward Cullen, a mysterious classmate who reveals himself to be a 108-year-old vampire.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
Summary: Four kids travel through a wardrobe to the land of Narnia and learn of their destiny to free it with the guidance of a mystical lion.

title: Winnie the Pooh
author: A.A. Milne
Summary: The adventures of Christopher Robin and his friends in which Pooh Bear uses a balloon to get honey, Piglet meets a Heffalump, and Eeyore has a birthday.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
Summary: The sole survivor of a lost whaling ship relates the tale of his captain's self-destructive obsession to hunt the white whale, Moby Dick.

title: Trainspotting
author: Irvine Welsh
Summary: Renton, deeply immersed in the Edinburgh drug scene, tries to clean up and get out, despite the allure of the drugs and influence of friends.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
Summary: Dracula, attempts to move from Transylvania and go to England to find some new blood and try to spread the curse of the undead. It also tells the story of the fight between Dracula and a group of men and women who had Professor Abraham Van Helsing as their leader.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
Summary: The gifted scientist Victor Frankenstein succeeds in giving life to a being of his own creation. However, this is not the perfect specimen he imagines that it will be, but rather a hideous creature who is rejected by Victor and mankind in general.

title: The Exorcist
author: William Peter Blatty
Summary: Regan McNeil, a 12-year-old girl, is possessed by the devil. A young priest in crisis of faith, helped by his elderly mentor, faces the demonic presence in a deadly duel.

title: The Castle of Otranto
author: Horace Walpole
Summary: Manfred, the prince of Otranto is keen to secure the castle for his descendants in the face of a mysterious curse.

title: The Pit and the Pendulum
author: Edgar Allan Poe
Summary: The narrator is sentenced for heresy by his inquisitors during the Spanish Inquisition. The mental break that follows results in confusion that makes the entire scenario even more frightening.

title: 1Q84
author: Haruki Murakami
Summary: A woman named Aomame begins to notice strange changes occurring in the world. She is quickly caught up in a plot involving Sakigake, a religious cult, and her childhood love, Tengo, and embarks on a journey to discover what is "real".

title: Shining
author: Stephen King
Summary: Jack Torrance, an aspiring writer, accepts the job of winter guardian of a hotel in a remote location in the Colorado Mountains. But his son Danny begins to experience visions of the terrible events happening in the facility.

title: Pet Sematary
author: Stephen King
Summary: Louis Creed discovers a mysterious burial site in the woods near his home. When his family is hit by a tragedy, a chain reaction brings terrible consequences.

title: Misery
author: Stephen King
Summary: Writer Paul Sheldon is the victim of a car accident in the Colorado Mountains. He is rescued by a woman, who welcomes him into the house, taking care of his wounds and proclaims herself as his avid reader.

title: The Man in the High Castle
author: Philip K. Dick
Summary: In a dystopian America dominated by Nazi Germany and Imperial Japan, a young woman discovers a mysterious film that may hold the key to toppling the totalitarian regimes. What would it be like if the Allied Powers had lost WWII, and Japan and Germany ruled the United States?

title: The Sympathizer
author: Viet Yhanh Nguyen
Summary: The Sympathizer by Viet Thanh Nguyen follows a half-French, half-Vietnamese man serving as a spy for the Communist forces in the final days of the Vietnam War. The novel is framed as a confession written by the narrator to a mysterious commandant, by whom he is being held prisoner.

title: Dark Days
author: James Baldwin
Summary: Drawing on Baldwin's own experiences of prejudice in an America violently divided by race, these searing essays blend the intensely personal with the political to envisage a better world.
